summary: This is an email chain regarding an ex parte submission in the criminal case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein (19 Cr. 490). It includes a forwarded message from a court clerk attaching a memorandum order from Judge Richard M. Berman, with a brief acknowledgment from the recipient.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the defendant in the criminal case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB).

persons.name: Christine Murray
persons.context: Sent an email from a court domain attaching a memorandum order from Judge Berman regarding the ex parte submission in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Richard M. Berman
persons.context: Issued an order (memo) related to a 16(d) letter in the criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Judge Berman presided over the criminal case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Court Order on Ex Parte Submission
events.description: Judge Richard M. Berman issued an order (memo) regarding a 16(d) letter in the criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein, which was attached to an email from court clerk Christine Murray.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated August 5, 2019, concerning the criminal case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein (19 Cr. 490).
It references an ex parte submission and a 16(d) letter, indicating ongoing legal proceedings and sealed or confidential filings.
A memorandum order from Judge Richard M. Berman was attached to the email, sent by court clerk Christine Murray.
The correspondence shows communication between legal personnel regarding court orders in the Epstein case shortly before his death.
